name: loge
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small separate area with seats in a sports stadium (= a large closed area with rows of seats around the sides and often with no roof): Almost half the loges were empty. The team announced that it would sell 1,200 loge seats in the upper deck at midfield.
a small separate area with seats in a theatre, either on its own above and to the side of the stage, or at the front of the lowest balcony (= an upper level of seats): Dance lovers will like the seats in the front row of the loge for their view over the stage. Compare
box
More examplesFewer examplesThere were increases in prices of club-level seating and the loge corner section.Everyone enjoys the game from the comfort of a loge outfield box seat.The stadium's 80,000-seat capacity comes from the 61,000 reserved, club, and loge seats, as well as suites and standing-room-only tickets in the end zones.
